It is modeled after Guilty Gear Isuka, and also allows for four player fights. It was the first versus fighting game for the Nintendo DS to be released outside of Japan.
Guilty Gear Dust Strikers is also the first Guilty Gear game so far to have mini-games, ranging from the Balance Game where you have to help a chibi Jam balance the falling items with her plate, to Venom's Billiards, which pits the player and his/her opponent in a pool-style game. The boss of the game's Story and Arcade modes is Gig, an immense insect-like monster with an angel attached to its bottom half that doesn't have many details. The game has 21 playable characters in all, but only twenty story modes, for Robo-Ky has no story mode.

Source: Wikipedia, "Guilty Gear Dust Strikers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

123963.name: Fudge Tékumel
123963.description:
User Summary
Fudge Tekumel is a game created through by utilizing the Tékumel: Empire of the Petal Throne world with the Fudge game system.

123964.name: The Hall of Fire (Issue 84 - Mar 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Featured Creatures: Deus Ex Machina... The Great Eagles
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
123964.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

123965.name: The Guild Companion (Apr 2012)
rpgissuearticle: The Art of Fighting Section 13: Exclusive Martial Arts Styles
123965.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

123966.name: System: The Customisable Hacker Game
123966.description:
System is a Player Versus Player card game on which Player's take on the role of hackers and try to take control over their Opponent's System Cards via damaging them by battling on the plains of cyberspace with the use of Virus cards while defending from their opponent's attacks with their own anti-Virus cards.

A Player starts with a Memory value of 0. During the start of a Player's turn they may play (upload) Anti-Virus Cards that increase a Player's Memory value while on the field and or Virus cards that decrease a Player's Memory value while active on the field. If anytime during the game, a player's Memory value is below 0, then they must send their active Virus cards from their field to the discard pile until their Memory value is restored to at least 0, if not higher.

In addition to Anti-Virus and Virus Cards, Players may also use "Input" costs which have a Memory Cost and can be activated at anytime except the Upload Phase by returning Anti-Virus cards that have an equal or higher memory value than the costs of the input card back to the owner's hand.

To reduce your opponent's System Points, you declare which Virus Cards you choose to attack with and then the defending player may block with an Anti-Virus card (An Anti-Virus card may block any number of Virus Cards but if it's Memory Value is equal to or less than the total sum of the Virus Card's Memory Value, it is destroyed)

If a Virus card attacks succesfully, you inflict 1 Critical Damage to your Opponent's System (ie you reduce their System Points by 1.) When an Opponent's System is reduced to 0, you win the game.

Start-Up
Both Players draw 5 cards. Player who goes first may not attack.

Phases

Draw – Turn Player draws 1 card
Upload – Turn Player uploads Anti-Virus or Virus Cards. No Input Cards may be activated.
System – Turn Player selects which Virus cards to attack with.
End – Some effects may happen here.




Zones

Deck - Directory
Discard – Recycle Bin
Field - Desktop
Hand - Hand
Removed From Play – Archive




Other Terminology

Card Collective (on table) - Program
Card Collective (off table) - File
Counter - Cancel
Destroy - Terminate
Discard - Delete
Effect - Process
Player - Host
Return - Buffer

123967.description:
User Description:

Star Confrontations utilizes paper miniatures in a science fiction wargame between armies of deadly warriors. Create an army by selecting which squads and vehicles your warriors will use. Every miniature possesses its own abilities and attributes so your army will always be unique.

This is the core rulebook for Star Confrontations. The rulebook includes two armies: Federation Marines and Orc Raiders.
123967.name: Star Confrontations

123968.description:
From the Introduction:

The Matrix Legion army book requires the Star Confrontation rules book in order to play. The Matrix Legion is a robot army that uses self repair to keep their army on the move no matter what damage their forces receive. Matrix robots use advanced stealth and teleportation technologies to dominate the battlefield.
123968.name: Star Confrontations: Matrix Legion

123969.description:
From the Introduction:

The Coalition Forces army book requires the Star Confrontation rules bookin order to play. This army book introduces the the Coalition Forces, which is a mass tropp army supported by APCs and heavy tanks.
123969.name: Star Confrontations: Coalition Forces

123970.description:
From the Introduction:

The Star Elf Guardian army book requires the Star Confrontation rules book in order to play. Star Elves are master snipers that use crossfire to tear enemy forces apart. Star Elf worlds have limited population so drones make up most of their military forces. These fearless robot warriors are tough as nails and each provides a special ability to their squad, making Drone Squads one of the most versatile and durable squads in the game.
123970.name: Star Confrontations: Star Elf Guardians

123971.name: Wild Hunt (Issue 36 - Jan 1979)
123971.description:
User Summary of Contents:

My Name is Legion #36 by Mark Swanson

How To Get Rich With Role Playing Games
Experience, Special Tasks & All That
Plate, Chain Mail & All That
Recent Evants in Gorree




The Golden Dragon by John T Sapienza Jr

Percentage Combat
Weapons Expertise
Negative Hit Points
Sapienza Armor Number System
Weapon or Shield Parries
Review of Creatures of Chaos 1
Daughters of Darkness - a scenario suggestion




Fenris Speaks #31 by Glenn Blacow

Thoughts on Armor Classes and Homing Teleport Rings




The Swenson Campaign part two by Anders Swenson

Review of Apple Lane
Monsterous Thoughts - the Pybra converted for use in RuneQuest




A Wizard / A Hero / A Fool by Richard Lesses

Local Politics in Kes-Kevar




The Name of the Game is Dungeons & Dragons #16 by Bill Seligman

Review of An Encyclopedia of Fairies by Katherine Briggs
Using Fairies in Role Playing Games
The Taking of Osay'zhna's Castle - Part I - The Kidnapping




A Wizard of Fire by Richard Lesses

Seanzine by Sean Cleary

Review of TSR's Monster Manual




My World & Welcome To It by Peggy Gemignani

That Which Slays #21 by Peter Arnson

Combat Options
Vampires

123972.description:
Add some primal action to your copy of Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Duel at Mt. Skullzfyre with Haggatha the Heffer's Crushazorian Godstorm. This promo carries the same great flavor and dark comedy that the original game features, and it adds plenty of new spell combinations for you to unleash on all of your foes!

6-card promo pack that includes 2 copies of these promo cards are available with purchase of the game at events

Formerly available at the Cryptozoic Entertainment e-store. Quote from a representative follows:

"Thank you for contacting us. We no longer have any stock of the Haggatha promo cards, so they do not come with the game anymore. Your best bet is to look for a reputable online re seller. If you have any further questions, please let us know.

Thank you,

-Cryptozoic Team"
123972.name: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Duel at Mt. Skullzfyre – Haggatha the Heffer's Crushazorian Godstorm Promo Cards
boardgamefamily: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Forty-One: PISSTER!

123973.description:
You won't ever find these Food Fight promos in a kid's meal! The sumptuous Cheeky Royale, Aunt Butterface, and Humping Dumpty can be added to your regular Food Fight game, allowing you to spice up gameplay with these tantalizing instants! Oh, and as an added bonus: they are a hilarious departure from the cleaner comedy you may find in your regular copy of the game.

The 3-card Food Fight promo pack can be acquired by purchasing the game from Cryptozoic Entertainment at events or through the Cryptozoic Entertainment e-store.
123973.name: Food Fight Promo Cards

123974.name: Alosar Emanli and the Creatures from the Fallen Star
123974.description:
From the publisher's website:

Druids vs. Aliens: Fight!

When a mysterious object falls from the night sky, apprentice druid Alosar Emanli stands alone as evil creatures from the stars invade his forest. Can he overcome the many dangers that lurk in the woods and defeat the alien brood? That’s up to you, the choices you make, and the luck of the die…

This stand-alone Party of One adventure is designed for a single player with no GM and basic rules. All you need to play is some dice (d6, d8, and 20), a pencil, some paper, and this book.

The rules are explained as you play. Begin at paragraph 1 and proceed from there, taking notes as you go.

Alosar Emanli and the Creatures from the Fallen Star includes both a 1st level and 3rd level character sheet for Alosar, fully compatible for use with any beginning Pathfinder Roleplaying Game party to continue your adventures!

123975.name: Endless Days
123975.description:
As your senior year is about to begin you promised yourself: It’s going to be legendary!
From Skipping School to Hack Grades to Road trips, you are ready to do whatever it takes to have a blast. Even if it involves subtle manipulation, a bit of betrayal and destroying a few hearts along the way.
And if things don’t turn out your way, gather your gang and Start a Teenage Riot!
This is your last shot to go down on history.

The goal of the game is to score the highest number of victory points. Players score victory points by:
- Successfully performing events:
- Accomplishing the Plan
- Beating the Snitch Brigade
If the Snitch Brigade defeats Bullies, players responsible for bulling loose victory points. So watch out!

Special Victory Condition
If a player manages to start a teenage riot he wins the game even without having most victory points.

Inspired by cult teen comedies “Endless Days" is a board game for 2 to 4 players, aged 12 and up that can be played in 25 minutes.

123976.name: Nosferatu: Run from the Sun
123976.description:
You are the cutest, fastest and nicest vampire of all time.
Can you escape the sun long enough to
achieve the fattest HIGHSCORE on the planet?
Whatever you do, be careful where you jump to, little Nosferatu!

Source: The Developer Website.

123977.name: Ready Steady Bang
123977.description:
A beautifully addictive quick-fire dueling game

Play face-to-face with a friend on a single screen in 2 player mode or pit your trigger finger against 10 of the fastest outlaws and collect a hoard of achievements along the way.

Progress through the game to unlock 31 unique cowboy deaths, then show them off in your Kill Gallery.

Game Center integration allows you to compete against a world of cowboys and girls.

Are you fast enough?

Source: The Game Website.

123978.name: Kroco Gems
123978.description:
Kroco Gems is a fast-paced puzzle game that is simple to play, but will keep you playing for hours.


Move the stacked blocks with a touch or turn them with two touches.
Create complete horizontal lines to destroy the blocks, allowing the gems to reach the bottom so the Krocos can eat them
You better hurry though, because if time runs out the will steal the Sugar Fairies will steal the gems from grasp of the hungry Krocos!
Create consecutive combinations and earn powerful bonuses that will help you destroy the blocks faster!
Complete the Story mode, which is 40 levels long to unlock the doors of the Sugar Fairies’ mythical castle of gems, so the Krocos can feast until their bellies are full!


Source: The Developer Website.

123979.name: Brandnew Boy
123979.description:
Rookie doesn’t know who he is, or how he got here, but one thing has been made terribly clear: he’ll have to fight to stay alive if he wants to find out. Brandnew Boy is heart-stopping, breath-taking 3D combat adventure built on Unreal Engine 3 for an unbelievable iOS action experience.

Source: The Game Website.

123980.name: Silversword
123980.description:
You remember ye olde Guild of Adventurers, don’t you?

In Silversword, this will be your starting point as well. You can form your own party which can contain up to 7 members. Always have a bard at hand if the moral is low, and a magician if the combat gets tough.

A rogue will surely get you around town with his streetlore.

The Bard’s Tale series is the template for Silversword, and thus, you may recognize some game elements. It is not a copy however: first, I don’t want to get into copyright hassles with Interplay, and second, there is no need to fill old wine in new skins. Silversword comes with its own compelling storyline, that will be in no way behind its idols for sure.

Silversword is using a d20 system similar to the old Dungeons & Dragons Pen and Paper RPG. The lower the AC (Armour Class), the better your chances of avoiding that fierce poisoned blade your enemy swings at you.

The interface is adapted to the needs of a mobile user. All can be done with touches, gestures and the built-in keyboard. Let’s start a fantasy world inside your pocket!

Use your skills, use your items, and use your spells to explore maps full of enemies, riddles and traps. Silversword will bring back the desire for solving puzzles – do you remember what desperately sought-after magic word had driven you insane a long time ago in your favourite CRPG? As for me, I know it… and this game will give you lots of them!

Silversword is a game about strategy, magic and imagination.

As soon as you run out of spell points on the deepest level of Ole Castle Cranbourghs Catacombs, your torch goes out and the shadows creep up on you – there won’t be much hope of a carebear teleport or exit that will lead you to safety again.

Scaring darkness is the only destination for you now. And when you can hear THEM coming… don’t forget some harmonic gems – and of course, a happy melody on your bard’s lips.

Source: The Game Website.

123981.name: Bean's Quest
123981.description:
Emilio has been cursed and his girlfriend kidnapped! Transformed by dark magic into a jumping bean, Emilio must bounce his way to victory through 50 levels spread over 5 worlds. Can Emilio rescue his one true love and find his missing pet axolotls?

Source: The Developer Website.

123982.name: La Balada del Español
123982.description:
From the back of the book:

ES QUE QUIERES VIVIR PARA SIEMPRE, GRINGO?

Monta en tu ruano, desenfunda tu seis tiros y galopa hacia la aventura de tu vida... Cruzarás Río Grande para adentrarte en territorio Comanche, te pudrirás en las cárceles mexicanas, lucharás en las filas juaristas contra Maximiliano y perseguirás un buen montón de plata maldita... Y sobre todo, participarás en la más endiablada cacería humana que puedas imaginarte, siguiendo el rastro a un maldito hijo de perra al que poco a poco aprenderás a odiar. Todo ello, acompañado de la más eficaz y carismática agente a las órdenes de Juarez: Sarita Veracruz, "La Chamuscada". Esta aventura puede hacerte recorrer todo el territorio de México, y llevarte más lejos aún... Quizá hasta una ciudad llamada Madrid.

La Balada del Español es un módulo oficial de M+D Editores para Far West, juego de rol, y no puede jugarse independientemente de éste.

Incluye un apéndice sobre la vida, costumbres e historia del México de la segunda mitad del siglo XIX.

English Translation:

DO YOU WANT TO LIVE FOREVER, GRINGO?

Get on your roan horse, draw your six-shooter and ride for the adventure of your life... You'll cross the Rio Grande to enter the Comanche territory, rot in a Mexican jail, fight in the juarista ranks against Maximiliano and chase a big heap of cursed silver... And above all, you'll take part in the most devilish manhunt that you can imagine, following the trail of a damned son-of-a-bitch which you'll slowly learn to hate. All this in the company of the most efficient and charismatic agent under Juarez: Sarita Veracruz, "La Chamuscada". This adventure can take you across the length of Mexico, and even beyond... Maybe to a city called Madrid.

La Balada del Español is an official module by M+D Editores for Far West, role playing game, and cannot be played without it.

Includes an appendix on the life, habits and history of Mexico during the second half of the 19th century.

123983.name: Top Spin Table Soccer
123983.description:
This is a Subbuteo replica using the HW miniatures of the 70s.

The box contains everything you need to play the good old Subbuteo, two teams with "moulded-type" miniatures (blue team and red team), two goals, two white balls and a cotton made soccer pitch.

As the Subbuteo, the rules here are alla about the flicking with your fingers of miniatures depicting actual football players. Any miniature can touch the ball no more than 3 times, after that you have to use another miniature. If another your miniature touches the ball, the previous miniature regains the maximum touches avalaibility. If you miss the ball, or this touches any of the other side's players, the ball possession passes to the adversary. Other rules include details to address situations like penalties, off-sides, free-kicks and such. This is after all a total Subbuteo-clone even in the popular ruleset that, from the 70s, has seen little or no change at all.

Anyone not happy with the new Subbuteo 2012 edition can still buy this one then!

123984.name: Death vs Monstars
123984.description:
User Summary

A shoot em up with a different take on the weapon systems. Wherever you move the weapon fires opposite that direction. It is also possible to sustain the direction of fire in a direction. Enemies will come from all over the screen. Weapon and character upgrades are available in the shop. Levels can be replayed as often as you like and you keep any money earned even if you die.

123986.name: Tofu Go!
123986.description:
Everybody loves tofu, save the last piece!

- Pixelicious graphics, with 60+ kinds of hotpot food you like!
- Addictive game play
- Adorable tofu that you must save from the evil chopsticks

This game is created solely upon the love for tofu.

Source: The Game Website.

123988.name: Tetris Revolution
123988.description:
Tetris Revolution is a fun new installment in the Tetris series which features all the core features of Tetris you'd expect, plus a lot more!. 12 new and classic mini-variations with 15 levels of difficulty. Save your best times and best scores for each individual mini-variation, then unlock new game modes. Watch the unique Replay viewer to see in-game replays of how the Tetris masters do it!

Source: The Developer Website.

123989.name: Pirâmide Matemágica
boardgamepublisher: Copag - Cia. Paulista de Artes Gráficas
123989.description:
The Egyptians were famous for hiding intricate mathematical expressions in their buildings, such as π, for example. In this game, each player is an explorer in Egypt, and must reveal the secrets of a mathematical pyramid.

Goal of the game:
Get to the top of the pyramid, revealing its secrets, and obtaining the most precious stones (treasures).

Playing the game:
In your turn, you need flip a card number ( pyramid's stone) and do mathematical operations that have this number as a result. You should do this for each stone in 2 minutes, and will be the turn of another player. Who gets reaches the top of the pyramid first, earn gems.
Three rounds are played, and the player who have more gems wins.

123990.name: MMMMMM
123990.description:
User Summary

MMMMMM is a puzzle game based on a gravity-flipping mechanic similar to that used in VVVVVV. The player has the ability to walk left and right and to set the change the direction of gravity to point away from the surface the player is currently touching.

The goal of the player is to travel through a maze collecting trinkets while avoiding the lethal spikes. A checkpoint system is used to minimize the cost of player death. Significant to the game is that both time and space are broken into discrete chunks, which puts the focus on solving puzzles and not on reflexes.

123991.description:
Taggle is a card game from 1 to 5 players.

Includes: 110 cards (50 'Thoughts' cards and 50 'Retort' cards).

Each player draws a card. One of the players read out loud one of the Thoughts lines: the other players, each at their turn, must use one of their 'Retort' lines to snap back the silliest or funnniest retort.

The player who fails to do that, or gives the lamest retort (after a vote by the players), is shouted out: "Taggle" and loses 1 point on the score track.

At the end of a round, the player with the most points loses the game.

Integrates with:


Taggle d'amour
123991.name: Taggle

123992.name: Anima: Ark of Sinners
123992.description:
User Summary

Anima: Ark of Sinners is an adventure game where the player controls Celia and Nemo as they explore the empty metropolis they wake up in.

123993.name: Votoms Simulation Manual
123993.description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese robotech animation "Armored Trooper Votoms".
This game issued five editions with Dual Magazine #6 to 10. Each edition use same basic rules with different map and units.

Players control one or more Armored Trooper (is Robotech name in this universe).
Each turn, players secretly fill out the log the action pattern and movement plan. Then, simultaneously resolve movement and combat. The combat include fire and close combat.

This game not contains any scenarios. In the basic game, each player use one Armored Trooper and battke to sedtroy the opponent. A skilled player can handle more Armored Troopers for large-scale battles.

123994.description:
New Deal is a solitaire card game in which you are trying to help the US recover from the great depression. You play as Franklin D. Roosevelt and will implement economic policies and deal with various crises that arise.

There are 8 objectives in the game, each representing an area of the US economy, such as Banking, Agriculture, and Public Works. The game is played over 15 turns. Each turn consists of 5 phases in which you 1) draw 9 cards 2) Play one crisis card (if you have one) 3) Play a legislative card 4) Play a set of cards to enhance one of the objectives 5) Discard between 1 and 5 cards. At the end of the game, you determine your final score by multiplying your lowest objective score with your highest objective score.
123994.name: New Deal

123995.name: Octoverso Junior
123995.description:
French word game's Octoverso Junior version. 8 double-sided letters are placed on a rotative rail. Each player must form a word using the letters in front of him. The word has to begin with at least the last 2 letters or end with at least the first 2 letters of the "word" currently on the rail. Since the rail rotates, that effectively gives 4 possibilities.

The first player to get rid of all his letters win.

The letters look more appropriate for young audiences and are marked with colors.

123996.name: Tomot Original
123996.description:
At start each player receives seven cards.
There are 2 letters on the cards, one black and another purple.

The goal is to find a word during 3 minutes with 3 or 5 black letters but using a purple letter in the middle of your word
to socre 2 points.

At the end of the lap, put your cards face down on the table except the card with used purple letter what You put on top of the deck face-up.

The cards are given to neighbors who have 90 seconds to find in the word of his opponent's word of 3 or 5 letters.
Each player announces the words they found.
If you can not find a word or Your word is smaller than word of Your opponent, his score is doubled.

With several rounds the player with the highest score wins.

123997.name: Tomot Thèmes
123997.description:
The game consists of 30 theme cards for the Tomot Original.

Each player receives seven cards of the original game and a theme card is drawn face-up on the table.
There are several themes like: Geography, Sports, Games etc.

In his turn player must give a word beginning with a letter from his card and related to the face-up theme-card. An answer can be given only once throughout that round.

The round ends when one player has given answer for each card from his hand. Then he scores a point.

A player must take an additional card, if He does not have words or he is too slow.

After several rounds the player with the most points wins.

123998.description:
"Les Enfants Maudits" or "the cursed children"
First scenario for the Ghost Stories expansion White Moon.
It proposes a specific setting and new rules to play the White Moon expansion.
It includes the set of rules in French/English and a new cemetery board.

The board and rules can be found on the Repos website. (see weblinks)
123998.name: Ghost Stories: White Moon – The Cursed Children

123999.description:
Green Roots is a downloadable scenario for the White Moon expansion to Ghost Stories, giving new powers to green ghosts.
It includes a set of rules in French/English and a new cemetery board .

The board and rules can be found on the Repos website. (see weblinks)
123999.name: Ghost Stories: White Moon – Green Roots

124000.name: Inception
124000.description:
This game is based on the movie of the same name. All players are extractors that play against one player chosen as the "mark", and while the extractors work together at first, there is only one winner, i.e they all turn on each other eventually.

There are 4 levels and Limbo. There is one safe per dream level, and in each safe is either hidden WORTHLESS MONEY, or the mark's secret ( the game objective ). The extractor to uncover the mark's secret wins. The mark wins when the deck runs out without anyone finding his secret.
